title: The rising prison population
subtitle: The prison population was about 45,000 in England and Wales in 1990 and 1991 and is now about 86,000.
author: fullfact.org
vclaim:
Almost—the prison population was about 45,000 in England and Wales in 1990 and 1991 and is now about 86,000.

The prison service is currently facing overcrowding. In 2014/15 almost 26% of prisoners were living in crowded conditions.

Overcrowding has existed across prisons in England and Wales almost constantly for the last two decades.
